other_tests.findings: The liver is homogeneous in echotexture without focal mass identified. The main portal vein is patent. Intrahepatic bile ducts are within normal limits. Common duct measures 3 mm. Gallbladder is unremarkable in appearance, without gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fluid, or gallstones. The pancreas is grossly unremarkable in appearance. The spleen is not enlarged measuring 7.2 cm. The left kidney measures 10.6 cm. No hydronephrosis. The right kidney measures 11.8 cm. There is no hydronephrosis. A wedge-shaped area of increased echogenicity is noted along the upper pole, along the cortical margin, and likely represents a small parenchymal scar, chronic in etiology.
